title.rendered: How should I eat or work out as an ectomorph / mesomorph / endomorph?

content.rendered:
The same way as everyone else, because there is no such thing. Collectively referred to as “somatotypes”, these classifications are the result of a now debunked theory of psychology and had nothing to do with predicting how one gained fat or muscle.

These concepts unfortunately stick around because they are powerful marketing tools to sell products and programs to those who don’t know better – be wary of anyone who treats these terms as legitimate.

jetpack-related-posts.title: How do I get more toned / How do I tone my [bodypart]?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The word "toned" is frequently misused as shorthand to the extent that it has made a simple concept into something that is unclear. Muscle tone is simply the amount of tension a muscle maintains when it's at rest. This misuse of "toned" to describe a specific look has led to the idea of…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Does cardio impair muscle gains?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: You may be here because you've heard the phrase "cardio kills gains" - Not to worry, this is a meme, and not reality. This meta-analysis of 10 studies found that doing cardio before resistance training had no apparent negative effect on hypertrophy, though it did negatively impact leg strength. This…
